title: BBC Local Live: Norfolk on Thursday, 10 March 2016 - BBC News
summary: a pilot who died during an air display had an undiagnosed heart condition , an accident report says .
motorists are warned they face delays in great yarmouth until at least the weekend after a water main burst earlier this week .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on friday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's it from the norfolk live team today , we 'll be back at 08:00 tomorrow .
we like to involve you in norfolk live , so if there 's a story or a photograph that you 'd like to share with us , you can get in touch on email , facebook or twitter .

documents.title: today 's big gooderstone water gardens
text: our big today is of gooderstone water gardens , in west norfolk .
taken earlier this year , it was sent in by paul easton - many thanks paul .
if you 've a that you 'd like to share with the rest of the county , please send it to us on email .

documents.title: weather : dry with isolated mist patches
text: it will be a dry evening , with isolated mist or fog patches forming by dawn .
minimum temperature : -1 ( c ) ( 30f ) .
after a chilly start tomorrow , it will be a dry day with bright or sunny spells .
temperatures will reach a maximum of 7 ( c ) ( 45f ) .
you can find more information on bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: world 's biggest offshore vessel prepares for departure
text: the world 's largest offshore vessel , has been put through her paces ahead of her departure from great yarmouth 's outer harbour .
scylla , which can sleep of crew of 130 , is due to leave for the netherlands by the weekend , where she 'll up components for wind turbines ahead of her first job off the german coast .
have a look at this piece of footage :

documents.title: maternity unit receives share of government funding
text: the maternity unit at the james paget university hospital has been awarded £ 23,000 in government funding to invest in new maternity safety equipment .
the money will be used to purchase two new cardiotocography machines , which measure the baby 's heart rate , and one new twin monitor and a new portable ultra sound machine .
head of midwifery , jayne utting , says the equipment will be a great addition to the unit .
the government had pledged £ 2m towards investing in safer maternity care .

documents.title: plane crash was 'tragic accident '
text: a fatal plane crash has been called a `` tragic accident '' by one of the victim 's friends who witnessed it .
an accident report published yesterday revealed there was no mechanical fault with the aircraft and that mr jenkins had an undiagnosed heart condition .
`` our thoughts are with his family they are re-living a very difficult time '' , said willie cruickshank , who was in david jenkins ' display team .
author: Zoe Applegate
BBC News

documents.title: canary call : the best clips
text: # canarycall classics .
we 've started uploading some of the best clips of last few years .
enjoy !

at least a point against man city !

@ twitterid looking forward to baz from taverham !

documents.title: the headlines : tributes to fatal crash pilot inquest into fire death
text: the stories in the news today :

documents.title: resident 's frustration at getting information from bt openreach
text: `` a company that provides communications is not communicating with its customers '' says a resident of a south norfolk village where people have been without phones or internet access since a car hit a bt cabinet last thursday .
colin cordey , who works from home , has tried on numerous occasions to get information from bt openreach .
`` there are two parts to this we need to get it back up and running , and to understand what bt openreach 's plans are to replace the box , '' he said .
the company says it hopes to restore connections to the 150 affected homes by the end of monday .

documents.title: tribute to aerobatics pilot
text: a friend of a pilot who died during an air display at old buckenham of an undetected heart condition has described him as a precise '' and talented pilot '' .

willie cruickshank , who was on the same wildcat aerobatics display team as david jenkins , 61 , and saw the crash last april , said the air accidents investigation branch report had confirmed his thoughts mr jenkins was not believed to be at fault .
there was nothing technological in the aeroplane ; it identifies that david was a highly professional pilot - he was never a rule-breaker , '' said mr cruickshank .
author: Zoe Applegate
BBC News

documents.title: scylla 'jacked up ' in outer harbour
text: scylla , the world 's largest offshore vessel , has been `` jacked up '' in the great yarmouth outer harbour .
its 105 metre ( 115 yards ) legs have lifted the vessel off the surface of the sea , to leave an air gap of 40 metres ( 44 yards ) .
this is the height it will be working at when it helps to construct a windfarm off the coast of germany .

documents.title: couple 's terror at arson attack
text: the front page of the norwich evening news :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: inquest into fire death
text: an inquest has been held into the death of a man who was killed when a fire broke out at his family home in north elmham in march last year .
the inquest at norwich magistrates ' court heard christian milburn , 50 , died from smoke inhalation and severe burns at the house in eastgate street , which has since been repaired ( seen above ) .
the evidence , heard by senior coroner jacqueline lake , did not fully disclose how the fire started.. a narrative verdict was recorded .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Norfolk Live

documents.title: golf club appoints women to key roles
text: for the first time in the 123 year history of the royal norwich golf club , women have been appointed to key roles .
angela loveday , who 's been a member for nearly 14 years , will be the first woman club captain in norfolk .
incoming president cherry bishop , a member for 24 years , has also been the ladies ' secretary and captain .
jasmine campbell and janet clare have been appointed junior captain and ladies ' captain , respectively..
the club says the appointments demonstrate its commitment to increasing female participation in the game .

documents.title: pilot death : friend watched crash unfold
text: an inquest into the death of an aerobatics pilot at a south norfolk airfield is to be held on 24 march .
david jenkins died when his edge 360 plane crashed at old buckenham in april last year .

willie cruickshank , a friend of mr jenkins , said he `` watched the crash unfold and along with many others who were there experienced pilots our assessment at the time was there was no attempt to recover from the manouevre , which led to the crash and led us to believe perhaps david was incapacitated . ''
author: Zoe Applegate
BBC News

documents.title: ndr : update on travel information
text: a road to the east of norwich which has been closed for site clearance work ahead of the construction of the norwich northern distributor road ( ndr ) is to reopen .
plumstead road , which is closed between thorpe end and little plumstead , will be open to traffic on saturday..
the nearby middle road will close on 14 march until 25 march .
to the west of norwich , drayton lane which had been expected to close from monday , will now be kept open until after easter..
the lane is a cut-through between the b1149 holt road at horsford and reepham road .

documents.title: body believed to be that of missing man
text: an area of old buckenham remains sealed off following the discovery this morning of the body of a man .
formal identification is yet to take place but norfolk police believe it to be nadeera de silva who was reported missing on 7 march .
mr de silva is from the local area , and his next of kin are being informed , police said .

documents.title: cyclist has 'no recollection ' of crash
text: norfolk cycling star victoria williamson says she 's ahead of schedule in her recovery from a serious crash .
the world championship bronze medalist suffered a broken pelvis and vertebrae at an event in holland in january .
she will definitely miss the olym in rio but is setting her sights on tokyo in 2020 .

documents.title: invsetigations continue into cause of burst water mains
text: motorists in great yarmouth are being warned to expect delays in the town centre until the weekend at least , while engineers continue to carry out repairs on a water main near haven bridge which burst earlier this week .
essex and suffolk water said investigations into the cause were continuing , and the leak was n't necessarily linked to an incident last week when a piece of machinery fell off an hgv on south quay .
at this time of year , the most obvious cause of burst water mains would be temperatures dropping cold weather and movements in the ground caused by the weather . ''

documents.title: disused pub to be turned into flats
text: a neglected pub in norwich is to be turned into flats .
norwich city councillors have voted 11 to one in favour of turning the ferry boat inn , on king street , into two properties , along with a five storey block of 39 flats .
the grade ii-listed building has had two planning proposals turned down in the past one to build around 40 apartments and another to turn it into a backpackers ' hostel .
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: youngs starts for england
text: norfolk 's ben youngs will once again start for england in their crunch six nations clash with wales this weekend .
the scrum-half maintains his place after the 21-10 victory over ireland two weekends ago .
england lead the six nations standings , with wales one point behind .
author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: work to improve coastal defences under consideration
text: work to look at improving the coastal defences to bacton gas terminal and neighbouring villages is continuing .
one option being considered is to `` sandscape '' the beach with high volumes of additional sand to help protect the coast from extreme weather .
north norfolk district council , the operators of bacton gas terminal , and the environment agency are investigating this option and how it could be funded..
it 's been trialled by the dutch successfully .

documents.title: 'you 're not alone '
text: the back page of the norwich evening news :
author: Norwich Evening News

documents.title: 'scylla ' jacked up to her full height
text: the world 's biggest offshore windfarm construction vessel , named in great yarmouth 's outer harbour last week , has been jacked up to her full height .
scylla is being put through her paces ahead of her first contract off the coast of germany .
she 's due to leave for the netherlands by the weekend , where she will up wind turbine components .
author: Andrew Turner
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: future of grade ii listed pub to be discussed
text: plans to turn a disused pub in norwich into flats will be discussed by city councillors today .
the ferry boat inn on king street has stood empty for a decade .
previous plans to turn it into a backpackers ' hostel were shelved .
proposals to build 43 apartments were turned down by norwich city council last year .
under the new plans , the grade ii listed building will be turned into two properties , and a five storey block of 39 flats will be built .

documents.title: norwich v rafa benitez 's newcastle ?
text: the future of steve mcclaren remains unresolved as head coach of newcastle united .
he 's expected to take charge of training today after face to face talks with magpie 's managing director lee charnley yesterday failed to materialise .
newcastle are second-bottom in the premier league , level on points with norwich city , but below them on goal-difference .
rafa benitez is believed to be newcastle 's preferred target should mcclaren be replaced .
norwich welcome newcastle to carrow road on saturday , 2 april .
author: Phil Daley
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: archive dream becomes reality for guiding
text: work has started to create a girlguiding archive centre in coltishall .
author: Network Norfolk

documents.title: public consultation on housing development
text: people in king 's lynn are being asked for their views on the latest stage of the controversial plans for housing near lynnsport .
the two areas between columbia way and the south of lynnsport would have a total of 88 homes between them , built by lovells in partnership with king 's lynn and west nofolk borough council .
the council is keen to get people 's views before a final plan is drawn up .
they 'll be on display at a drop-in session at the lynnsport leisure centre today until 20:00 .
author: Nanette Aldous
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: williamson 'lucky not be paralysed '
text: norfolk 's victoria williamson says she is lucky not to be paralysed after her serious crash at rotterdam 's zesdaagse .
the 22-year-old fractured her neck and back , dislocated her pelvis and slipped a disc in her neck after colliding with elis ligtlee during the omnium final .
`` they were pretty sure paralysis was going to be the outcome while i was in rotterdam , but luckily i pulled through , '' she told bbc look east .
`` being an athlete , i think they said because my neck and back were so strong i was able to withstand the force . ''
author: Phil Shepka
BBC Sport

documents.title: sort it out
text: the back page of today 's eastern daily press :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: travel : a47 blocked in both directions
text: the a47 to the west of norwich is blocked in both directions at hockering because of an accident involving four vehicles .
there 's more information on bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: traffic delays following burst water main
text: businesses in great yarmouth say trade is being affected by emergency roadworks .
a water main burst near haven bridge on monday and the ongoing repairs are causing traffic delays across the town .
it 's thought things wo n't be back to normal until the weekend .

tony cox from car parts company eu on southgates road says it takes two hours to get to gorleston from the town , and they 're having to run two bikes to get around , but there is a limit to what they can carry on a moped .

documents.title: crash pilot had heart condition
text: the front page of the eastern daily press :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: body discovered in old buckenham
text: the body of a man has been discovered in old buckenham .
police were called after a member of the public made the discovery shortly before 07:00 off doe lane .
formal identification of the body is yet to take place..
the area remains sealed off while police inquiries continue .

documents.title: villagers left without phone or internet access
text: residents of a south norfolk village have been left without phone or internet connections after a car hit a cabinet containing important cables last thursday .
bt openreach say around 150 homes in old buckenham will have lost their service .
they say they 're working to get connections to the affected properties working again by the end of monday at the latest .

documents.title: death crash pilot had 'heart problem '
text: an accident report says a pilot who died during an air display at old buckenham had an undiagnosed heart condition .
stunt pilot david jenkins , 61 , from stanton near bury st edmunds , died when his aircraft came down during a press day last april .
the air accidents investigation branch report says there was no mechanical fault with the aircraft , and that an undiagnosed heart condition may have made mr jenkins lose control .

documents.title: headlines : death crash pilot had 'heart problem ' villagers left without phone or internet access
text: the headlines :

documents.title: weather : cloudy start but brightening up later
text: it will be a rather cloudy start with perhaps with the odd spot of rain in the west .
it will brighten up through the day however , with sunny spells developing .
you can find more details on the bbc weather website or see my full forecast below
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: good morning !
text: welcome to today 's norfolk live page , where we 'll bring you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates .
we 'll be here until 18:00 this evening - if you 'd like to get in touch with us , you can email us , post on facebook or tweet us .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live
